CatDescriptText: Miss Mildred Brown, student, 611 Fifth Avenue, Coraopolis, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 11, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that students are getting adequate vocational counseling in the schools these days? Do you have any suggestions for increasing or improving it?" answer reads: "I think so.  I know at my school the teachers are continually encouraging us in our studies and attempting to inspire us to go to college."
TitMainTitle: Two women, including Mildred Brown on left wearing light colored button down collared sleeveless blouse with crewel work design and eyeglasses, holding dark tooled leather clutch, standing in front of store window
